column4: yeah, I found out a couple of days a go.  I wanted to see if someone knew anything about it
if you're looking for an autocad replacement for Linux, you're out of luck. I myself have looked deeply for such an application a year or so ago. The best I could come up with was pycad.
then you at least tried and/or seen linuxcad right?
I assume netbeans has some kind of conf file, which is a better thing to use?
mnepton: thnx guys, now it is installing
i think it is some kind of binary
yes, but what are you talking about?
why do we have to chmod 755 the .bin files?
If I had any idea what permissions 755 represented I would tell you. I only have 000 and 777 memorised. =P
you need execute permissions to execute a file. Any file, be it shell script or binary executable.
of course not! That's a huge security risk. Imagine if someone just sent you a script which consisted of "rm -rf /". What would happen if any n00b user could just run it?!
